body:
+1 
Still a problem in click v6.2

Bash completion isn't working properly beyond the first click command level.
I've noticed this problem as well.  Some `git bisect` experiments indicate that the problem was introduced in commit 0a2919f34fcbc635d8530b4c5b60bf119b2bcedb on Nov 24th.

Still observing this issue with click v 6.3 and the current development branch  57c6f09. (Using python 2.7 on OS X in ZSH using bashcomplete (bashcompinit).

instead of getting tab completion providing:

```
cmd sub_cmd1 cmd_1_options ...
```

Autocomplete endlessly completes at the sub command level and never moves into the sub_command itself for auto completion:

```
cmd sub_cmd1 sub_cmd1 sub_cmd1 ....
```

Downgrading to click v 5.1 fixes the issue.

```
pip uninstall click
pip install -Iv click==5.1
```

issue.title: click bashcomplete falls short of one argument, shows wrong options

repository.name: click
repository.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit

issue.body:
Using the following application: https://gist.github.com/untitaker/b05a2c321b6303974152
and this line to activate bash completion:

```
eval "$(_LOL_COMPLETE=source lol)"
```

We find a few bugs:
- Typing `lol<space>`, and hitting tab N times, it completes to `lol sub sub sub`, where `sub` is repeated N times.
- Typing `lol sub --` and hitting tab will suggest options that are registered on the group, and are invalid in this location.

This patch fixes both problems:

``` diff
diff --git a/click/_bashcomplete.py b/click/_bashcomplete.py
index 43feffb..fd62137 100644
--- a/click/_bashcomplete.py
+++ b/click/_bashcomplete.py
@@ -29,6 +29,7 @@ def get_completion_script(prog_name, complete_var):


 def resolve_ctx(cli, prog_name, args):
+    args = [''] + args
     ctx = cli.make_context(prog_name, args, resilient_parsing=True)
     while ctx.args and isinstance(ctx.command, MultiCommand):
         cmd = ctx.command.get_command(ctx, ctx.args[0])
```

and I have no idea why.

issue.title: fix for bug #530 / #471

repository.name: click
repository.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit

issue.body:
This is a fix for #530 / #471.

Fix was posted in #530 by @untitaker, I just created a pull request but @untitaker should get the credit for the fix!

I can confirm that it corrects the problem on my side. All tests still pass for me. I would write a py.test test but I'm not sure how to do a test for bash autocomplete Suggestions for how to write the test are welcome so we could avoid the problem down the road again. I just don't know how.
